image_1.description: A guard wearing a black balaclava and light blue uniform, opening a cell door, part of the prison system where criminal groups exercise unchallenged authority over inmates.
A prisoner with short hair, wearing a white shirt and shorts, exiting the cell, part of the incarcerated population in prisons run by gangs.
Another guard in a light blue uniform standing by, observing the situation, within the context of prisons acting as a safe haven for criminal leaders to remotely run their criminal enterprises.
A prison cell with metal bars and a perforated door, part of the prisons where criminal groups exercise unchallenged authority over inmates and run criminal enterprises from prisons.

Multiple prisoners in white uniforms standing behind the bars, observing the scene, within the context of prisons acting as a safe haven for criminal leaders to remotely run their criminal enterprises.

image_2.description: The graffiti-covered tunnel in San Salvador where an elderly man was standing, which is also a location where prisons are run by gangs.
Various writings and drawings on the walls of the tunnel in Latin America, reflecting the unchallenged authority of criminal groups within the prisons.
Several posters attached to the wall of the tunnel in Latin America, indicating the presence of criminal activities and gang control within the prisons.

image_3.description: Border Patrol Officers are individuals wearing green uniforms with 'BORDER PATROL' and 'POLICE' on the back, equipped with tactical gear and sunglasses, who are involved in escorting an individual.
An individual dressed in casual clothing, wearing a backpack, and being escorted by Border Patrol officers.
A white van with open rear doors, used for transporting individuals by Border Patrol.

image_3.merged_entity_name: ROAD - LOCATION OF BORDER PATROL INTERACTION
image_3.description: The location where the interaction between Border Patrol officers and the individual is taking place.

image_4.description: New York City experienced a significant increase in poverty levels, with nearly two million residents living in poverty, including one in four children. The situation was exacerbated by the end of Covid Aid programs that had previously helped to counteract job losses and rising costs during the Coronavirus Pandemic.
source_text_entities: CENTER ON POVERTY AND SOCIAL POLICY AT THE COLUMBIA SCHOOL OF SOCIAL WORK

image_5.description: A woman with her hair styled in a bun, wearing a light-colored blazer and earrings, resting her chin on her hand.

image_6.description: Monster Jam is an event featuring large, white monster trucks with black and red accents, equipped with oversized wheels, performing stunts on an indoor dirt track. It includes trucks like Grave Digger and Zombie that soar through the air and crash to the ground, attracting a rapt crowd in Newark.
